prompt: Quine's critique of the analytic/synthetic distinction challenges what?
options: The clear separation of logical from empirical truths
The use of symbols in logic
hint: Quine argued there's no sharp line between truths of meaning and truths of fact.
explanation: Quine's 'Two Dogmas of Empiricism' (1951) attacked the idea that logical/analytic truths ('all bachelors are unmarried') are fundamentally different from empirical/synthetic truths. He argued all beliefs face experience as a web - even logical laws could be revised if doing so simplified our total theory.
visual_concept: Instead of two types of truth, Quine saw a spectrum: some beliefs are more central to our web, but none are absolutely unrevisable.
